content: In the Quran Allah swears by the locations of stars. Skeptics claim that whoever wrote the Quran made a mistake, all stars are at the same locations that they appear. Today scientists confirm that when we look at stars we are actually looking into the past. By the time for light to reach us all those stars would have moved to other locations.

The time it takes for light from objects in space to reach Earth means that when we look at planets, stars and galaxies, we're actually peering back in time.
When we look up at the stars in the night sky, we are looking back in time. The light entering our eyes from these distant objects set off years, decades or millennia earlier.
heading: Every time we look at something ‘up there’ we’re seeing it as it was in the past.
reference_title: Sky At Night Magazine, When we look at the night sky, we're looking back in time. This is how far back we can see, 2024
